name: Charlton Heston Movies Trivia Game | Charlton Heston | 10 Questions

questions.text: "The Ten Commandments" was a legendary epic. Who directed it?
questions.explanation:
Cecil B. DeMille

	This one had the legendary C.B. at the helm. One of the most famous movies of all times - always shown on the appropriate holidays.

questions.text: "The Big Country" was a western which cast Heston as a tough guy. Who was the principal star of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Gregory Peck.

	Peck is the dude who must adapt to the Old West. Okay, but overblown.

questions.text: "Ben-Hur" is considered one of the masterpieces of movie-making. The best known scene is the chariot race. Heston wins the race; what happens to the loser?
questions.correct: He is injured in the race and dies
options: He commits suicide due to shame
questions.explanation:
He is injured in the race and dies.

	Stephen Boyd does a fine job in the key supporting role. He is injured in the race and dies shortly thereafter.

questions.text: "El Cid" is also an epic tale with Heston in the title role. Who is  his leading lady?
questions.explanation:
Sophia Loren.

	Also overblown and not on a par with his other "spectaculars" - but not all that bad.

questions.text: "The Greatest Show on Earth" was an entertaining circus adventure. Who was NOT in the cast with Heston?
questions.explanation:
Betty Grable.

	Wilde was the aerialist. Grahame was another performer. Stewart was a clown. Heston's romantic interest was Betty Hutton, however - not Betty Grable.

questions.text: "Planet of the Apes" was a Heston sci-fi story. Which statement accurately describes the plot?
options: He journeys into the future of another planet
He journeys into the past of another planet
questions.explanation:
He journeys into Earth's future.

	He thinks he's on another planet, but when he discovers the Statue of Liberty, the sad truth is revealed.

questions.text: "Will Penny" also starred Heston. What type of movie was it?
questions.explanation:
Western.

	A "quiet" western - with an emphasis on character (rather than on action).

questions.text: Which of the following is a Heston western?
questions.explanation:
Major Dundee.

	"Billy" stars Robert Taylor. (There have been other versions, but none with Heston.) "Sergeant" was a weak effort by John Ford; it starred Jeffrey Hunter. "Return" was a sequel to the Tyrone Power movie about Jesse James; it starred Henry Fonda.

questions.text: Heston portrayed this president in two different movies.
questions.explanation:
Andrew Jackson.

	He played Jackson in "The Buccaneer" and in "The President's Lady". The first was about Jean Lafitte and the Battle of New Orleans; the second was about Jackson's romance with Rachel.

questions.text: Heston starred in "The Agony and The Ecstasy". Who was the movie about?
questions.explanation:
Michelangelo.

	Ah, the hardships involved in painting the Sistine Chapel! Kirk Douglas starred as Van Gogh in "Lust for Life". Jose Ferer starred as T-L in "Moulin Rouge". (Not the Nicole Kidman version.)
